title: UP Records Most Number Of Crimes Against Women, PM Modi Meets Abhijeet Banerjee + More Top News
text:
UP Records Most Number Of Crimes Against Women, PM Modi Meets Abhijeet Banerjee + More Top News

UP Records Most Number Of Crimes Against Women, PM Modi Meets Abhijeet Banerjee + More Top News

More than 3.5 Lakh cases of crimes against women were registered across the country in 2017, continuing with the upward trend for the third consecutive year, said the latest data by National Crime Records Bureau. Read more

Here's more top news of the day:

1) PM Narendra Modi Meets Noble Laureate Abhijit Banerjee, Says 'India Is Proud Of His Achievements'

Prime minister Narendra Modi today met Abhijit Banerjee, who along with Esther Duflo and Michael Kremer won the coveted Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences. Modi applauded Banerjee’s passion towards human empowerment is clearly visible and shared a picture from the meeting on microblogging platform Twitter. Read more

2) Inequality Is Out Of Control In India And It May Get Worse, Says Former IMF Economist Dev Kar

With its huge population and natural resources, India is a giant among nations but instead of building muscles that would have strengthened it, it has put on a lot of weight making it top-heavy, says the chief economist emeritus at Global Financial Integrity, Dev Kar. Read more

3) This Contrasting Image Of Delhi's Skyline Shows How Badly Air Pollution Has Affected Delhi In The Last One Month

The present Air Quality Index (AQI) in the national capital is around 232 which is considered 'Poor'. On Monday, the AQI was hovering around 310 which is considered 'Very Poor'. Dust and smog continued to envelop Delhi as the AQI fell to the 'very poor' category. Read more

4) From 2021, Those With More Than Two Children Won't Be Eligible For Government Jobs In Assam

Assam has become the first Indian state to have a cap on the number of children to be eligible for government jobs in the states. Read more

5) BJP MP Sadhvi Pragya, Who Earlier Praised Godse, Goofs Up & Calls Mahatma Gandhi 'Son Of The Nation'

Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MP from Bhopal, Pragya Singh Thakur, also known as Sadhvi Pragya, who has earlier embarrassed her party with her frivolous and valueless comments, now called Mahatma Gandhi “son of the nation”. Gandhi is revered as the “father of the nation”. Read more
